page.title: 15PROBLEMS OF THE YOUNG IN 85
page.content: Upon leaving school, Taffs Well looks to be a pretty bleak place to live in. School does little to prepare you for the harsh realities of the outside world, frequently leaving you to figure out your rights under the Welfare State on your own. Knowing what money you're entitled to after leaving school is vitally important in such an area, as full time jobs are few and far between. Local industry is dead, and the choice seems to be between leaving Taffs Well to look for work, or staying in the area and finding place on the YTS. The social life of the area is as run down as it's industrial life. Apart from the youth clubs, which cater primarily to those still at school, there is very little of interest to the young adult.
